description: COSHOCTON A 13- year-old Coshocton boy was taken to Akron Children's Hospital after being injured a crash on Tuesday. The Coshocton County Sheriff's Office received multiple 911 calls at 4:27 p.m. about a juvenile being hit by a car while was riding his bike. Emergency medical services stabilized the cyclist and took him to the Coshocton County Regional...
text:
COSHOCTON A 13-year-old Coshocton boy was taken to Akron Children's Hospital
after being injured a crash on Tuesday.

The Coshocton County Sheriff's Office received multiple 911 calls at 4:27 p.m.
about a juvenile being hit by a car while was riding his bike. Deputies
arrived to find the 13-year-old alert and talking.

The driver of the vehicle, a 27-year-old Coshocton woman, was at the scene.

Emergency medical services stabilized the cyclist and took him to the
Coshocton County Regional Medical Center to wait for MedFlight, which took him
to Akron Children's Hospital for treatment.

Deputies determined that the boy was riding his bike, without a helmet, east
bound through an alley and did not stop when he entered the roadway in the 600
block of S. Eighth Street.

The motorist was southbound on South Eighth. She hit the bike because she was
unable to stop in time.

The driver was cited for driving under license suspension.

Assisting deputies at the scene were Coshocton County EMS and Prince's Wrecker
Service. This accident is under investigation.

title: Bicyclist at fault in crash
html:
COSHOCTON A 13-year-old Coshocton boy was taken to Akron Children's Hospital after being injured a crash on Tuesday.

The Coshocton County Sheriff's Office received multiple 911 calls at 4:27 p.m. about a juvenile being hit by a car while was riding his bike. Deputies arrived to find the 13-year-old alert and talking.

The driver of the vehicle, a 27-year-old Coshocton woman, was at the scene.

Emergency medical services stabilized the cyclist and took him to the Coshocton County Regional Medical Center to wait for MedFlight, which took him to Akron Children's Hospital for treatment.

Deputies determined that the boy was riding his bike, without a helmet, east bound through an alley and did not stop when he entered the roadway in the 600 block of S. Eighth Street.

The motorist was southbound on South Eighth. She hit the bike because she was unable to stop in time.

The driver was cited for driving under license suspension.

Assisting deputies at the scene were Coshocton County EMS and Prince's Wrecker Service. This accident is under investigation.
